Definition at line 67 of file string.c.

int strcmp ( const char *  s1,
const char *  s2 
)

The strcmp() function compares the two strings s1 and s2.

Parameters:
s1 The first string to be compared.
s2 The second string to be compared.
Returns:
It returns an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero if s1 is found, respectively, to be less than, to match, or be greater than s2.

int strncmp ( const char *  s1,
const char *  s2,
size_t  n 
)

The strcmp() function compares the two strings s1 and s2 up to the nth character.

Parameters:
s1 The first string to be compared.
s2 The second string to be compared.
n The amount of bytes to be taken into acount form each string.
Returns:
It returns an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero if s1 is found, respectively, to be less than, to match, or be greater than s2.
